definition: daring/bold/audacious
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
reckless/extremely daring
fullness for the bold, famine for the timid (idiom)
pinyin: cheng1 si3 dan3 da4 de5 , e4 si3 dan3 xiao3 de5
containing_words.word: 撐死膽大的，餓死膽小的

sentences.english: It is a bold mouse that nestles in cat's ear.
sentences.chinese: 再膽大的老鼠也不敢在貓耳朵裏做窩。

sentences.english: Aggressive and timid driving behavior is what leads to stop-and-go traffic.
sentences.chinese: 膽大和膽小的駕馭行爲導致了交通堵塞。

sentences.english: She was a very brave little girl – she dared to do all kinds of things.
sentences.chinese: 她是個很膽大的小女孩，她什麼事都敢做。

sentences.english: It is audacious, disruptive and preposterous on the face of it.
sentences.chinese: 表面看來，其膽大妄爲，且顛覆常理，又荒誕可笑。

sentences.english: It's a bold mouse that nestles in the cat's ear.
sentences.chinese: 再膽大的老鼠也不敢在貓耳朵裏做窩。

sentences.english: She rode up bold as you please, m'lord, demanding words with you.
sentences.chinese: 她膽大包天的徑直騎了過來，大人，要求和你說話。

sentences.english: His daring daughter dashed into his bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 他那膽大的女兒衝進他的臥室。

sentences.english: I hope you will forgive me for my nerves .
sentences.chinese: 我希望你能原諒我的膽大妄爲。

sentences.english: IS THERE any limit to the audacity of Scandinavians?
sentences.chinese: 這些膽大包天的斯堪的納維亞人就不知道個“度”嗎？

sentences.english: Here, Madoff made his most audacious innovation.
sentences.chinese: 在這一點上，麥道夫創造了他最膽大妄爲的發明。

sentences.english: Now that they were backed up, these fellows became audacious in the extreme.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有人撐腰，這幫傢伙就變得膽大包天。

sentences.english: Though the task is urgent, you should be both bold and cautious.
sentences.chinese: 任務緊急，但你還需膽大心細。

sentences.english: But this is my 99th column and that makes a man feel reckless.
sentences.chinese: 不過，這是我第99篇專欄，我感到分外膽大。

sentences.english: He said this nuclear capability could embolden the government in Tehran.
sentences.chinese: 他說，這種核能力會使伊朗政府更加膽大妄爲。

sentences.english: The man must be as bold as brass to have stolen money at mid-day.
sentences.chinese: 這男子膽大包天，居然在中午光天化日下偷錢。

sentences.english: Bello Nock, the star daredevil clown of the Ringling Bros.
sentences.chinese: 玲玲馬戲團中藝高人膽大的明星小丑貝洛。

definition: courage/boldness/guts
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to force someone to do something
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to abuse roundly
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
by fair means or foul/by hook or by crook/unscrupulously
to get sth done once and for all
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
path/conduct/behavior
idle gossip
enthusiasm for doing sth
